The Universal Welcome does not pass the High Contrast accessibility test.

To see how the Welcome renders under High Contrast (in Windows), go to
My Computer > Change a setting > Accessibility Options > Display tab

You will see no images appear.  In the case of using the setting "High Contrast Black", on the Root page of the Welcome, only the Eclipse logo appears.

High Contrast settings turn the background images off in IE. Currently, in place of using img tags in the Eclipse Welcome, divs with the background set the to the desired image are used.  Thus when switching to High Contrast, the (background) images are not appearing.

What is the guideline for high contrast pages:

1) Use the src tag to show the image
2) Don't show the image at all and replace it with a textual link

FIxed for both Circles and Purple Mesh. 

It is not particularly pretty, but either image or text is shown for each link.

The fix seems to have brought about another problem, which is causing the indexing to fail. Bug 136679 is also to blame for this, which I intend to fix soon (for RC2).
